closed_reason: Added Approve and Reject convenience methods to Client at lines 404-414 of internal/ticks/client.go. Both wrap SetVerdict: Approve calls SetVerdict(taskID, 'approved', '') and Reject calls SetVerdict(taskID, 'rejected', feedback). Feedback note uses --from human via SetVerdict's AddNote call.

run.output:
I'll implement the Approve and Reject helper methods for the ticks client. Let me start by reading the current client.go file to understand the existing SetVerdict implementation.

Now I understand the existing code. The `SetVerdict` method is at line 388-402. I need to add `Approve` and `Reject` convenience methods that wrap `SetVerdict`. Let me add these methods after `SetVerdict`.

The methods are implemented. Now let me run the tests to ensure everything passes.

All tests pass. Now let me also run the full test suite to make sure nothing is broken.

All tests pass. Now let me close the task.

Task complete. I implemented the Approve and Reject convenience methods in `internal/ticks/client.go` at lines 404-414:

- **Approve(taskID string)** - Calls `SetVerdict(taskID, "approved", "")` with no feedback
- **Reject(taskID string, feedback string)** - Calls `SetVerdict(taskID, "rejected", feedback)` with the provided feedback

Both methods wrap SetVerdict internally. The feedback note in Reject automatically uses `--from human` via the existing AddNote mechanism in SetVerdict. All tests pass.

title: Implement Approve and Reject helper methods
